title: United States Constitution: Article 1, Section 8, Section 17
subtitle: The United States Constitution does not prevent the Federal Government from taking the title "to any real estate property" without the consent of the State.
author: David Mikkelson
vclaim: Article 8, section 1, of the Constitution of the United States states that "the Federal Government may never own title to any real estate not specifically authorized by this Constitution, such as gardens, forests, dams, watercourses and grazing areas without the consent of the State in which such property is located."
